pal 0.0.9070
  • Reference

Assert MIME type

Source: R/pal-GEN.R
assert_mime_type.Rd

Asserts a response object is of a specific MIME type. Convenience wrapper around httr::http_type().

assert_mime_type(
  response,
  mime_type,
  msg = paste0("The response's MIME type is {.val {mime_type_actual}} ",
    "but expected was {.val {mime_type}}."),
  msg_suffix = ""
)

Arguments

response

A response object.
mime_type

The expected MIME type, e.g. "application/json". A character scalar.
msg

The message to display in case of an error. Supports cli's inline markup. A character scalar.
msg_suffix

An additional string to append to msg. Supports cli's inline markup.

Value

response, invisibly.

See also

Other HTTP functions: is_http_success()

Examples

httr::GET("https://api.github.com/users/salim-b") |>
  pal::assert_mime_type("application/json") |>
  httr::content()

#> $login

#> 
#> $id
#> [1] 20040931
#>

#> [1] "MDQ6VXNlcjIwMDQwOTMx"

if (FALSE) {
httr::GET("https://api.github.com/users/salim-b") |> pal::assert_mime_type("text/plain")}
